turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: What was that ?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: He must have had a gun stashed. God damn it !

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: We can't afford too many surprises.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: He'll never make it out of the park alive. I promise you that....

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Will he make it out ?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Of course, this one's a gimme. Just be patient, even Ol' Bruce can't outwit some of these traps.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: What's next ?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I have a turn for the worse for the team !

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: I do believe Mr. McCray will be most pleased with the tape of this one.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I've got five bucks that says someone dies here and now.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: I'll see that bet.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Aren't you going to switch exits on him again ?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Why ? The crocks are all going for the dead crock. There's no fun in it. Besides we've got plenty more for them. The night is young....

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Maybe you should get over fears.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Well, Mr. Parker it seems that your is not the wardrobe of choice tonight. I'm quite confident that my tie is looking better than yours.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Look he figured it out !

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: I can see your small business ! Look at it it's so small.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Look ! Look !

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Shit, I forgot about them. Well, I guess the boss man wasn't as tough as I thought.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: I don't know. Maybe we should watch the tape to be sure.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: You're paying the bills.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Was that the Old Man ?

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Yes. I think he's feeling sick or something.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: There ! There ! Did you see ! They're still alive !

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I can see that but where ?

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: That is repugnant. You have the habits of a goat.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: <<belch>>

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Ach ! How will you know if they've made it ?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: The room will fill to the top, then if they wind up in the next room, they lived, if not, they're dead.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Thank you very much.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Goddamn it Bruce, you've cost me about thirty dollars so far.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Okay, I have five that says THIS is it for them.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I think I'll see hat action.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: So what's next ? No one's ever made it this far before.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: He's got two chices.either it's the Bowling Alley from Hell or Alice in Murderland. See this ? Even Bruce knows that no one can make it out of here in one piece.

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: What the ... ?

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: What happened ?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: The power went out in half the park.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: How can this happen ?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: I don't know. I think that a power grid just needs reset. Don't get your panties in a bunch. I'll go down and reset it.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Go in there ? What if Bruce finds you ?

turns.speaker: JOHNNY
turns.text: Yeah, right. He's stuck all the way over here

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Good golly miss molly you are looking good today !

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: I meant him.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Just look at this tie. You could fry an egg off that orange, yow. Have you ever considered the Jerry Garcia line of ties ?

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Excuse me, gentlemen

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Come on, I'm serious. Look at Wilma. She's this frail little thing, and Fred, I mean Fred Flintstone is this BIG guy. He has to be hung like a horse, and THAT's why Wilma puts up with his B.S.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: I've never heard the Flintstones reduced to a sexual exploitation quite like that. You're funny.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Listen, I was thinking, you know. Would you go, it's I think you're...

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Do you want to go out with me ?

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: It's sounds so much better when you say it. I'm semi traditional here, and it's important that I ask. Will you go out with me ?

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Really ? On a date ?

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Yes.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: This is too easy, I mean I had a speech prepared, then I even wore these pants because I could get on my knees to grovel.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: As appealing as that sounds...

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Dinner at my place then ? Say, seven o'clock ?

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Sure.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Hi. I brought some wine.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Thank you, won't you come in ?

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: What an incredible view !

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Are you okay ?

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Yes, Excuse me for a second.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: You have a real nice place... how can you afford this working as a temp ?

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Well, I make good investments, I lead a double life as a secret agent.. I....I ... I have very rich parents. I have always had a lot of money.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: If they're so rich, why are you working at all ?

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: I just want to have something that's mine, you know ? It's like living off of their money is fun and all. There are certain materialistic needs that I have that can only be satisfied with that extra little scratch.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Like what, a Porsche ? A Ferrari ?

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Would that impress you ? I mean you're the kinda woman that probably has Ferrari written all over your personal ad.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Actually, I'm more interested in the man behind the wheel more than the manufacturer. So what is it that you have that makes you a materialistic fool ?

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: My own sit down Star Wars arcade game. Wanna play it ?

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Okay, now go under go under it ! Shoot Vader's Tie Fighter ! Get Him Get Him !

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Yahoo !!!!!

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Not now, Mom.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Wake up, we're in trouble.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Hey... did we uhm, you know....

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: No ! Just get up. This is serious.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Hey, you ! What the hell is going on ?

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: What the hell kind of cop are you ?

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: I think we should follow him...

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: I just need to sit and think for a second.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Are you okay ?

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Fine, fine, I feel like a chicken McNugget.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: The roof is coming down.... hey, you.... Which door gets us out of here ??

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Which one, this door is locked !

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: I'm talking to you asshole !

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Maybe all that testosterone plugs his ears.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: You don't have to sound so emphatic.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: We just having our first date when you showed up.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: How's your foot ?

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: "How's your foot" ? This guy tried to kill us and he put us in this place, and you want to know how his foot is ?

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Jesus Christ ! I'm just a temp for Christ sakes !

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Shut up ! It's me.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: I think I'm very quickly getting over my phobia of public urination.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: What ?

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Nothing.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: It's that asshole Zach isn't it ?

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Zach from work ?

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Are you okay ? Any holes ? I mean aside from the one's that nature gave you ?

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: I'm fine.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Hey Matty, don't wait for me or anything.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: I was thinking maybe we should try this dinner thing again, but maybe the Epcot version will be open by then....

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Sweet Jesus I never dreamed I'd be glad to see Central Park at night.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: We made it !

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: What now ?

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: I want to go to sleep for about a month.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: No, idiot. Where do we go now ?

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Where are we ?

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Thanks a lot. I always wanted to know what it was like to see my life flash before my eyes for the one hundredth time tonight.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Come to the rescue again I see.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: He was right behind me !

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Who was that guy anyway ?

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Hey good lookin' ! What'cha got cookin' ?

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Hey buddy. You okay ?

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Of course I am. I feel the testosterone coursing through my veins.  Now that I've gotten the stitches removed from my arm and the chiropractor fixed my back.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Ow. Son of a .....  Did I ever tell you my theory on Star Wars as Porn ?

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: Well, I think if you take several lines out of context, Star Wars becomes a very sexual movie. I mean listen to this.  "Luke, at that speed will you be able to pull out in time ?" or "You came in that thing ? You're braver than I thought".

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: No sir. I was just getting , well you know. Water. We weren't talking about sex or anything else except Star Wars. Just saying hello. I think I'm gonna go now.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Why don't you shut up now.

turns.speaker: MATTHEW
turns.text: I'm going to go ahead and go now.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Good morning.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Good morning.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Did you see what the First Bank stock opened at ? Very impressive.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Actually it's down .2 from the last quarters highest, but I think it will pick up.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: I am equally impressed with your knowledge of the market. How long have you been with the company now ?

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Four years. I came over from the Capitol merger in Chicago six months ago.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Were you involved in the incident where that guy killed himself in his office ?  I am sorry. Perhaps we should have dinner tonight to.... discuss your future.

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: We start with the top and work our way down. We start with the high salaries and then just let the little people go. No need to make the blue collars go crazy.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: I disagree. I think we should start looking into the severance pay schedules and make sure the people with families can.....

turns.speaker: ZACH
turns.text: Look, Miss. I know you're still upset about that incident in Chicago, but understand, this is a cut throat business. We don't have time to play nursemaid to every single Tom Dick and Harry.

turns.speaker: SAUNDRA
turns.text: Maybe we should make the time. Especially considering the sixteen million dollars we have set aside expressly to settle law suits from these very events.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: You had to remind me?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Are you writing a poem?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: No, I'm writing to the phone company because they keep charging me for calls to Caracas, Venezuela...do you know any know anybody in Caracas, Venezuela?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Umm, where do you want this?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Oh, just put it over there.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Do you still teach?

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: No, no, no, I gave it up ten years ago...actually it gave me up.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: My mother took this course with you at UCLA..."The Foundations of Poetic Thought".

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: UCLA? My cardigan sweater period.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Her name was Maggie Muldovan.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Ohhhhh.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: People said she looked like me.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: I was drinking a little in those days.  I'm drinking a little these days too.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I'm sure she found your lectures fascinating.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Oh I doubt it...lectures are notoriously boring.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: No they're not. I wanna be a writer, I wanna be just like you.

turns.speaker: ALFRED
turns.text: Humph, meee?? My dear, this is not a country that rewards poetry, this is a country that rewards gas mileage, besides, people don't read poetry anymore, they watch television. Don't be a poet, be a TV repairman.

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: Excuse me I asked you a question.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I'm not supposed to talk to strangers, not even nuns.

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: You're Vada right?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: How did you know my name?

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: Your Uncle Phil told me.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Where is he?? He was supposed to meet me.

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: Hey relax, you think I kidnapped him or something?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: This is California, anything is possible.

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: Well if I was looking for a victim, I definitely wouldn't pick your Uncle Phil who outweighs me by about 150 pounds, besides, who would I ask for ransom? You??

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Are you suffering from a chemical imbalance or is it just an attitude problem.

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: My only problem is that your Uncle Phil is giving me five bucks to pick you up but I don't get paid 'till delivery.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Gee, that is a problem.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Put that down, I'll...I'll call the police!

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: What are you gonna do? Tell them that...a polite person helped carry your bag?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I don't think you're very polite.

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: Yeah, well I don't think you're very grateful. A lot of people in your position would say "thank you".

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: THANK YOU.

turns.speaker: BOY
turns.text: Don't mention it.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I don't even know your name.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What kind of sleazoid geek would turn her in?

turns.speaker: DARYL
turns.text: I would do it again in a minute.

turns.speaker: DARYL
turns.text: Well maybe you should join a hippie commune. But let me tell you something. Sooner or later it's gonna be your turn to take out the garbage.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: What about giving the other guy a break.

turns.speaker: DARYL
turns.text: What about living in the real world pal?

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Give us a break. All you have to do is make a phone call.

turns.speaker: DARYL
turns.text: I thought I told you to lose this guy.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: Look, sergeant I know I said some things last time that I shouldn't have said at all but...

turns.speaker: DARYL
turns.text: I think the phrase was "Sleazoid Geek".

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: I'm sorry okay...we gotta find this guy because...he knew Vada's mom and he could tell her stuff that no one else knows.

turns.speaker: DARYL
turns.text: You're still asking me to break the law.

turns.speaker: NICK
turns.text: So charge him with something...who's gonna know?

turns.speaker: DARYL
turns.text: Me, I'll know!

turns.speaker: DARYL
turns.text: It's too bad about your mom. At least she went peacefully, I've seen a lot of people go out the hard way.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: What do you remember about her.

turns.speaker: DARYL
turns.text: Well, we worked on the school paper together. I remember when the Legion of Decency declared Rebel without a Cause unfit...boy...that Jim Backers, what an actor uh? What an actor.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Wow, you walked out with my mother?

turns.speaker: DARYL
turns.text: You kidding? he picks up a picture and shows Vada and Nick

turns.speaker: DARYL
turns.text: She was the uhh...first girl ever suspended for smoking.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Suspended from school, my mother??

turns.speaker: DARYL
turns.text: Everyone was really surprised when Maggie was turned in, she got kicked out for two weeks.

turns.speaker: DARYL
turns.text: I'm not authorized to trace licenses for civilians.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: His name is Jeffrey Pommeroy and he used to drive a 54 Ford pickup, black with red interior. Please?

turns.speaker: DARYL
turns.text: Yeah, this is Sergeant Tanaka from Holenbeck, I need a current address for a Jeffrey....

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Pommeroy.

turns.speaker: DARYL
turns.text: Pommeroy...he may or may not be driving a black 54 Ford Pickup.  Monday.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I'm leaving Sunday.

turns.speaker: DARYL
turns.text: Could you hold on for a second?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Do you wanna be a hall monitor all your life?

turns.speaker: DARYL
turns.text: Hello, I'm gonna need this right now...this guy...well we think he might be going after the governor.  Twenty minutes? Fine.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Vada, try to scrunch these chairs together a little more.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Dad, I'm trying.  The chairs, they won't scrunch.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I got a card from your Uncle Phil in Los Angeles today, said he went body surfing.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I don't know if I can picture Uncle Phil body surfing.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Do what?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Well the thing is your room is right next door to ours, and so we thought, well, I thought, if you were willing we might move you to Grammoo's room, and use your old room for the nursery. See we're gonna be up half the night with a newborn and there'll be a lot of noise....

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: You want me to move?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Well not far, just down the hall. Plus Grammoo's room's a lot bigger, and you get a view of the whole neighborhood.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Okay, no problem.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Okay thanks, atta girl.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Visualize a spare?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Well you know what I mean.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: So, what's on your mind?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Me? What makes you think there's something on my mind?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: You're passing up Archie Bunker to go bowling, you've gotta have an angle.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: No, I just thought it'd be nice if the two of us had an evening out so we could... talk.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Shelly's already told me all about sex.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: She told me too, I mean, she told me she told you about sex, I personally new about sex long before I met Shelly.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I figured you did.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Ahh, strike, not, not bad at all. No, this talk isn't about sex, it's, well there've been a lot of changes, and I know you're upset about losing your room, but the baby's gotta go somewhere.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: No it's okay, I understand, really.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Honey that's very mature, I'm proud of you Vada.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Maybe I should just move to China. One kid per family, that way you don't lose your room.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Hey, why don't you just keep your room and we'll put the baby in the back yard.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Don't do that, you've got the whole garage.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Oh yeah, right-between the power mower and the weed killer.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Dad I'm kidding, you can have the room.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Seriously?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Seriously.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Great.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Dad, when a boy likes you, does he pretend that he doesn't like you? And if he pretends that he doesn't like you how can you tell that he likes you?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What boy likes you?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: It's just a question, it's not about anybody.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: So you're saying...What are you saying??

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Honey, ahh, guys don't wanna appear over anxious, so if you think there's a boy that might like you, let him know that you like him, so he won't feel he's taking such a risk when he's thinking of asking you out.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: The Collected Works of Alfred Biedermeyer

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Her favorite poet.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: There's still a big spot on the floor.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Okay, we need wallpaper paste.  Hey Cece!

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Oh, is there anything else you remember, how did you propose? Was it romantic?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Well, I kinda just blurted it out over a root beer float.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: She was talented, but honey I wish I could help you a little more, it's just that your mother and I had kind of a whirlwind courtship, she came to town with this traveling theater group, I proposed on our second date, two weeks later we were married and almost nine months later you were here and she was gone.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Was it a nice funeral?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Oh yes, lovely funeral, Gernaldi brothers did a beautiful job, lots of pink roses...I used the white hearse. Hey, how about this flowered wallpaper for your room?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: You were just having a fight about me. Wouldn't you like to hear my opinion?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Of course.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I think that if I'm old enough to accept a new baby, and if I'm old enough to accept a new room, I'm old enough to go to California.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Honey I know it's fun to think about these things but....

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I already bought a ticket.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: What??

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I used my own money and got a great deal, it's a Q47NR five day fare, which means that I have to change planes in Dallas and stay over a Saturday.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: No nuns, got it.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: And no boys, promise me, oh those LA people are all so corrupt you'll end up pregnant and on drugs...and don't come running to me when you wake up in the city morgue with a tag on your toe having been beaten up into an unrecognizable pulp by some surfer...and DON'T make eye contact, it communicates an implied vulnerability.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: What does that mean?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: It means...I'm a paranoid nitwit who's never let his baby girl out of his sight for the simple reason he's a paranoid nitwit. So why don't you just say "Oh Dad" and get on the damn plane already?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Bye Dad, I'll miss you.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Thanks, I needed that.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I'll be back in 137 hours.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Have fun.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Hello? Sultenfuss Parlor.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Hi Dad.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Hi honey.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I just called to say that I'm having a really great time.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Good! You should go over and watch some Ted Carson.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Actually, I wanna see Jeffrey Pommeroy.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Totally groovy huh?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Totally.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Ask him if he needs a good tuba player.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: I will. How's Shelly?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Oh she's fine...ahh...umm the doctor just...ehh...told her to stay in bed and get a little rest and...'n stay quiet...just...just to make sure that...

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Okay...bye daddy, I love you.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I love you too sweetie, bye.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Give my love to Shelly.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: What happened to Shelly?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: She just had a baby that's all.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: We have a baby?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Uh huh, a boy, you've got a new brother.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Can I see him?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: You can do anything you want. You're his sister.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Hey you're not eating your meatloaf.

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: If I eat it I'll throw up.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Well you should at least try a little bit.

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: Then I'll throw up a little bit.

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: I don't know if I want to.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Vada I wanna ask you a favor, remember you can absolutely say no if you want to.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Oh, she's fine, she'll love her new room.

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: Look we react to every kick this baby gives, maybe Vada's trying to tell us something too.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Oh, Shell, that's ridiculous, where are my needle nosed pliers?

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: Listen, if a boy wants to do homework with you, it really means he didn't have nerve to ask you out on a date, so you'll get your homework together and pretend to be studying, and the next thing you know you're ordering pizza and talking about your favorite movie stars.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Well if there was an article about it I'm sure she did. She was always reading.

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: Yes I know, it runs in the family.  New book?

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: Never heard of him.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: How about a nice glass of milk?

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: And some taco chips so I can dunk.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I told you about the pumpkin didn't I?

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Ah, well, I bought her this huge pumpkin for Halloween, but she couldn't bear to carve it so she saved it for weeks, and it ended up under the Christmas tree.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: She can spread her wings, right here in Pennsylvania. You don't send a child alone to Los Angeles, she could come back with her ears pierced, her legs shaved and God knows what else.

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: She is not a child Harry, she is a young woman, she's on the brink of...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Disaster, disaster lurks behind every  palm tree.

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: You're being narrow-minded.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Yeah and they forgot to ask for one who wasn't having hormone surges.

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: Oh come on Harry, we're talking about five days here.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I really think we're going overboard for just a simple school assignment.

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Reason? What reason?

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: Phil's moving to LA, Grammoo's passing, the baby being born, Vada's report, I think...

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: I'm sorry I couldn't come pick you up honey.

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: I was pushing as fast as I could.

turns.speaker: SHELLY
turns.text: Maybe he's wet?

turns.speaker: HARRY
turns.text: Maybe he's hungry.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Are you the Hillary Mitchell who went to school with Maggie Muldovan?

turns.speaker: HILLARY
turns.text: Maggie Muldovan? Did you...know her?

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: It's okay really, I was just a baby.

turns.speaker: HILLARY
turns.text: I'm sorry, it's just...I've been taking all these seminars to get in touch with my feelings and...sometimes it gets out of hand.

turns.speaker: VADA
turns.text: Thanks.

turns.speaker: HILLARY
turns.text: I remember Maggie...and your Dad too, you know we used to all pile into his old 54 Ford pickup. "Chuck the Truck" we used to call it.
